title: Curate
summary: A curate (/ˈkjʊərɪt/, sometimes /ˈkjʊərət/) is a person who is invested with the care or cure (cura) of souls of a parish. In this sense, "curate" correctly means a parish priest; but in English-speaking countries the term curate is commonly used to describe clergy who are assistants to the parish priest. The duties or office of a curate are called a curacy.
